newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israeli helicopters attack south Lebanon.
newsitem.headline: Israeli helicopters attack south Lebanon.

text.p: Israeli helicopters fired rockets at suspected Hizbollah bases in south Lebanon on Friday, security sources said.
Earlier, Israeli security sources said Israeli soldiers ambushed a group of guerrillas who had infiltrated into Israel's south Lebanon occupation zone on Friday, killing one of them.
Lebanon's pro-Iranian Hizbollah group claimed responsiblity for the infiltration and said its guerrillas ambushed an Israeli patrol, wounding several soldiers.
Security sources said two Israeli helicopters fired two rockets into the Jabal al-Rafi' area in the Iqlim al-Toufah mountain ridges, a bastion of Hizbollah.
There was no immediate report on any casualties in the attack which occurred at 9:50 a.m. (0650 GMT).
It was the first Israeli air raid in Lebanon in more than a month. On August 8, Israeli fighter planes blasted Hizbollah targets in the Syrian-policed Bekaa Valley in east Lebanon.

The Israeli sources said an Israeli patrol fired with machineguns and rocket-propelled grenades at a group of guerrillas in the Wadi Slouki valley on the edge of the western sector of the border zone.

In Beirut, Hizbollah said in a statement: "A group of resistance fighters infiltrated into the Wadi Slouki valley and ambushed Israeli soldiers patrolling on foot at 7:30 local time (0430 gmt) with machineguns and rocket-propelled grenades inflicting a number of injuries among them".
The statement made no mention of the killing of a Hizbollah guerrilla.
It was not immediately known from the Israeli security sources if the Israeli soldiers suffered any casualties in the exhange of fire.
Later, Israeli gunners fired shells into Lebanese-held areas facing the valley, the sources added.
There was no word on any casualties in the bombardment.
Hizbollah, fighting a guerrilla war to oust Israeli troops from south Lebanon, has killed 18 Israeli soldiers so far this year.
